fields.summary: Consolidate the implementation of GetFileInfo(), GetListings() and GetContentSummary() into a single class

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Currently when we call getContentSummary() on standby it will not throw StandbyException.
fields.summary: getContentSummary() on standby should throw StandbyException

comments.body: added {{checkOperation(OperationCategory.READ);}} and Uploaded the patch.. Kindly review once..

This message was automatically generated.
Test failures are unrelated and checkstyle is because of file length..Kindly review the patch.. thanks

Thanks [~brahmareddy]. You bring up an interesting point, why getContentSummary is allowed on Standby NN when stale read is disabled. {{TestQuotasWithHA}} actually calls {{HAUtil.setAllowStandbyReads(conf, true);}} first.

* Is {{waitForLoadingFSImage}} needed given {{NameNodeRpcServer}} has checked via {{checkNNStartup}}?
* Maybe you can just modify {{TestQuotasWithHA}} instead for the test case.

Otherwise, it looks good.
+1 To this fix, but I defer to Ming to +1 final patch - don't have time to review because dealing with disastrous 2.7 deployment issues.  This was actually one of them.

This message was automatically generated.
Test failures are unrelated..Kindly review

Nit: Maybe use {{HAUtil.setAllowStandbyReads(conf, false);}} in the new test case? +1 once it is fixed.

Regarding why {{waitForLoadingFSImage}} is called in other places, perhaps you can open a jira to discuss if we can remove those calls. It seems if {{checkNNStartup}} returns true, the image has been loaded.

[~mingma] Updated patch which will use {{HAUtil.setAllowStandbyReads(conf, false);}} to make consistency in the testcase..

bq.Regarding why waitForLoadingFSImage is called in other places, perhaps you can open a jira to discuss if we can remove those calls. It seems if checkNNStartup returns true, the image has been loaded.

will raise separate issue for this..
